claims.claim: Virtual assistant reduces operational workload by handling frequently asked questions and appointment queries before escalating to live agents
claims.quote: By using self-service and intelligent routing, the VA aims to reduce the total number of calls that the Patient Access Team needs to handle, reducing operational time and costs.

claims.claim: Digital solutions free up staff time by automating patient interactions
claims.quote: IBM Consulting and AWS provided investment and technology for UHCW NHS Trust to pilot new solutions focused on digitizing patient interactions to improve their experience and free-up staff time.

claims.claim: Automated systems improve patient satisfaction and clinical outcomes through easier appointment management
claims.quote: An automated outpatient appointment reminder and change request system, built using a serverless architecture on AWS. This makes it easier for a specific subset of patients to receive reminders and reschedule appointments – further improving patient satisfaction and clinical outcomes.

claims.claim: Digital self-service platforms enable staff to focus on more complex queries
claims.quote: Most industries have moved to digital self-service platforms that make life easier for users and improve their satisfaction with services, whilst enabling staff to focus on more complex queries.

claims.claim: Automated email responder resolves patient queries more quickly by requesting missing information
claims.quote: An automated email responder using Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES) to ask patients to provide missing information so their queries can be resolved more quickly.

claims.claim: Digital preparation reduces pre-operative anxiety in children, with 50-75% of children affected by such anxiety
claims.quote: Pre-operative anxiety affects 50-75% of children and is associated with worse physical and mental outcomes for the patient.

claims.claim: Digital psychological preparation prevents negative post-hospital behavioral changes that affect 50% of children
claims.quote: Fifty percent of children develop negative post-hospital behavioural changes, such as separation anxiety and bed-wetting; 8% of these changes are on-going at one year post-procedure.

claims.claim: Digital preparation reduces financial implications from cancelled operations and ongoing medical costs
claims.quote: Additionally, there are financial implications for the hospital and wider society, for example due to cancelled operations or ongoing medical costs due to treatment non-adherence.

claims.claim: Digital app provides cost-effective psychological preparation compared to traditional face-to-face meetings
claims.quote: Currently, this is predominantly provided via paper leaflets and a single face to face meeting pre-admission; it is thus limited by cost and time.

claims.claim: Digital solution provides easily adoptable enhancement to patient experience
claims.quote: The Little Journey App has provided an easily adoptable solution to enhance the patient experience for children and their parents when they are visiting hospital for a planned procedure.
